column6: Management of material topics
column13: Carsales' newly launched Sell Assist service in Australia provides sellers with an ad score before publication, helpful tips and actionable suggestions to enhance their ad and achieve the best ad performance, making the selling process smoother.
column20: Sell Assist, seller, ad score

column6: Management of material topics
column13: Carsales' Encar Home Service provides peace of mind for buyers, with its team not only acting like a buyer's agent in the initial enquiry stage and setting up a test drive but also delivering the car after a thorough 129-point check and with a seven-day refund guarantee.
column20: Encar Home Service, peace of mind, buyer

column6: Management of material topics
column13: Carsales' SELECT product allows buyers to reserve a vehicle with a dealer online through a fully refundable deposit. It was successfully launched in Australia in 2021, and Carsales' international businesses have since adopted the concept.
column20: SELECT product, dealer, refundable deposit

column6: Management of material topics
column13: Carsales' Encar Guarantee confirms for buyers that a car exists at the dealership, whether it has been involved in an accident and provides peace of mind that the advertised car's specifications are correct.
column20: Encar Guarantee, dealership, car's specification

column6: Management of material topics
column13: In Chile, digital services like Oneclick are supported by Autofact, providing information and security when buying a used car. An Autofact Report lists the complete history of any vehicle in a few minutes, reducing the risk of finding unpleasant surprises.
column20: Autofact, Oneclick, a used car

column6: Management of material topics
column13: In Brazil, Carsales' Webmotors team introduced the "Vistoriado" badge. The badge helps buyers identify vehicles inspected by Webmotors' partners. The inspections are carried out by qualified technicians and come with detailed digital reports providing information the buyer needs to know.
column20: Vistoriado badge, an identified vehicle, a qualified technician

column6: Management of material topics
column13: Carsales tracks consumer sentiment through regular on-site surveys. Carsales' consumer sentiment tracker in Australia signposts changing consumer priorities Ã¢ÂÂ from buying in a Covid-19 climate in 2020 to the impacts of macro pressures such as interest rate increases, rising inflation and the cost-of-living crisis 2023. Carsales uses this intelligence to help its dealer community stay abreast of trends and better prepare their businesses to accommodate consumers' wants.
column20: Consumer sentiment tracker, on-site survey, consumer priority

column6: Management of material topics
column13: In Australia, Carsales embedded a thought leadership program in FY22/23 with a regular cadence of consumer research around topics such as Electric Vehicles, Agency Models (Direct Sales), and Finance and Insurance, with research insights feeding into commercial go-to-market decks. Carsales' media business also invested in technology to mitigate the risk from 3rd party cookie deprecation and to open new opportunities to deliver sector-leading media solutions to its clients.
column20: Thought leadership program, consumer research, research insight

column6: Management of material topics
column13: Carsales' Trader Interactive has released new premium placements, allowing dealers to promote their inventory within its marketplaces. It has significantly increased views for these dealers over traditional placements across RV, Cycle, Truck and Equipment.
column20: Premium placement, inventory, marketplace

column6: Management of material topics
column13: Trader Interactive's RV Trader launched its Statistical Survey program as the industry's trusted source for RV consumer and retail registration data. Through this program, RV Trader provides dealers access to a wealth of information to help them improve sales and capitalise on opportunities in their market.
column20: Statistical Survey, retail registration, information

column6: Management of material topics
column13: In 2021, Carsales introduced NEXT, an initiative supported by a team of senior leaders across its business who are dedicated to exploring and executing future horizon opportunities. NEXT works alongside the Carsales business to harness ad-hoc internal innovation with a strict focus on the future of the car industry and adjacent markets to build new and disruptive global businesses.
column20: NEXT, future opportunity, internal innovation

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column7: Carsales generated A$ 781 million in revenues in 2023.

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: Carsales' Melbourne head office is certified as carbon neutral through the National Australian Built Environment Rating System (NABERS) and has achieved a 4.5-star NABERS energy rating and a 6-star NABERS water rating.
column20: Head office, carbon neutral, NABERS

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: Carsales' website features an Electric Hub, a one-stop shop for all things electric Ã¢ÂÂ from the latest EV news and buying advice to expert reviews on all the key EV brands. It includes EV Ready, a short questionnaire that helps the consumer to determine whether they are "ready" to purchase an EV, then recommends brand new EVs that are best suited to them based on their current setup, budget and driving habits.
column20: Electric Hub, EV, EV Ready

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: The number of EVs advertised on carsales.com.au continues to grow, with over 2,000 electric and over 4,000 hybrid vehicle advertisements now appearing on Carsales' website. Carsales also improved its EV search filters to include battery range, capacity and plug type, making it easier for consumers to search for EVs.
column20: EV advertisement, hybrid vehicle, search filter

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: Carsales maintains a formal risk register that captures material and other potential risks to the business and assesses the nature, likelihood and materiality of the impact of each risk, including climate-related risks. Carsales uses the results of the assessment to inform its risk management strategy. A review and update of its formal risk register is conducted at least twice a year.
column20: Risk registers, climate-related risk, risk management strategy

column6: Defined benefit plan obligations and other retirement plans
Financial assistance received from government
column7: Carsales received no financial assistance from the government.

column6: Ratios of standard entry level wage by gender compared to local minimum wage
column7: In Australia, Carsales adheres to national minimum wage and award requirements. All Carsales employees are paid above the minimum wage, and a modern award covers employees. This is reviewed annually to ensure Carsales pays compliantly with the relevant award.

column6: Proportion of senior management hired from the local community
column7: Carsales hired 97% of its senior management from the local community.

column6: Infrastructure investments and services supported
Significant indirect economic impacts
Proportion of spending on local suppliers
column7: There were no cases of modern slavery in Carsales' supply chain.

column6: Operations assessed for risks related to corruption
Communication and training about anti-corruption policies and procedures
column13: Carsales takes a zero-tolerance approach to bribery and corruption. It is required that everyone conduct business in a manner that is compliant with anti-bribery and anti-corruption laws in all relevant jurisdictions. It is communicated to the employees via Carsales' Global Code of Conduct and Global Human Rights Policy, which has been rolled out to all businesses. New starters must read and acknowledge these policies at the time of hire.
column20: Global Code of Conduct, bribery, corruption

column6: Communication and training about anti-corruption policies and procedures
column13: Carsales established a risk management framework designed to assist the company in achieving its strategic and operational objectives. The Board is responsible for determining the company's tolerance for different risk categories, and management aligns the company's vision, strategy, processes, technology and governance accordingly.
column20: Risk management framework, strategic objective, risk

column6: Confirmed incidents of corruption and actions taken
column7: There were no instances of corruption in 2023.

column6: Legal actions for anti-competitive behavior, anti-trust, and monopoly practices
column7: There were no instances of anti-competitive behaviour in 2023.

column6: Approach to tax
column13: Carsales' tax strategy is in line with its risk management framework. While it is not publicly available, the board reviews and approves the strategy and administers it by the Carsales' Tax, Treasury and Risk function. Underpinning the tax strategy is Carsales' belief in paying its fair share of tax in each of its jurisdictions.
column20: Tax strategy, risk management framework, tax

column6: Tax governance, control, and risk management
column13: Carsales engages in public policy advocacy via participation in Treasury working groups and indirectly via interaction with the Corporate Taxpayer Association and other key taxpayers in the digital classifieds sector to drive and support improvements in tax governance within the industry in which it operates. Carsales is committed to transparent dealings with revenue authorities and maintaining open and cooperative relationships.
column20: Public policy advocacy, Treasury, Corporate Taxpayer Association
